briefdescription.para: A pointer to an NGL::Camera.
The position that the camera will always accelerate towards.
The distance between the camera and the focus.
Temporary distance for avoiding obstacles.
The angle of the camera about the focus.
The height of the camera relative to the focus.
Velocity value used to amend with the physics simulation.
a pointer to the PhysicsWorld to use
Constructor for the camera class.
destructor
Called each frame to update the camera's position.

parameterdescription.para: - the name of the PhysicsWorld body for the camera to focus on

briefdescription.para: Can be called as an alternative to updatePos. Snaps the camera's position to the default position OR snaps the camera's position to the chosen angle.

parameterdescription.para: - the name of the PhysicsWorld body for the camera to focus on
- the angle to rotate the camera about the focus

briefdescription.para: Can be called as an alternative to updatePos. Sets the camera's ideal position based on input values and lets the PhysicsWorld handle the motion. Less jarring than snapPos.

parameterdescription.para: - the name of the PhysicsWorld body for the camera to focus on
- the angle to rotate the camera about the focus
- alternative focus for the camera if desired

briefdescription.para: Returns the Eye vector.
Sets the Eye vector.
Returns the Look vector.
Sets the Look vector.
Returns the view matrix.
Returns the ViewProjection matrix.
Returns the Projection matrix.
Returns the distance between the camera and the focus.
Sets the distance between the camera and the focus.
returns the height of the camera
sets the height of the camera
Returns the angle of the camera about the focus.
Sets the angle of the camera about the focus.

parameterdescription.para: - the angle to set in radians

briefdescription.para: Returns the ideal position of the camera.
Sets the ideal position for the camera.
Sets the camera's shape.
Contains the camera used for rendering and controls its movement.
